Key Match Events: Bradley Beal scored 25 points off the bench, including 20 in the second half, to help the Suns end a four-game losing streak with a 109-99 win over the Sixers.
Post-Match Reflections: Bradley Beal said he hadn't heard from the Suns regarding a potential trade, which he would need to sign off on thanks to the no-trade clause in his contract.
Head coach Mike Budenholzer said after the game the decision to bench Beal and Jusuf NurkiÄ‡ was made because the Suns 'needed to make a change' after a four-game losing streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns' bench outscored the Sixers' bench 54-7 in the comeback victory.
Others: Bradley Beal considers himself a starter and where the Suns place him in the lineup going forward could potentially influence his willingness to consider a trade if Phoenix looks to move him.
